newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia says will not issue Eurobond at high price.
newsitem.headline: Russia says will not issue Eurobond at high price.

text.p: Russia will not issue its debut Eurobond at a high price, Interfax news agency quoted Finance MInister Alexander Livshits as saying on Monday.
"We are not after quantity, trying to borrow a lot of money at any price," Livshits told Interfax.
He did not give any terms of the issue, which he has previously said would be around $500 million.
The Russian government earlier ordered the dollar-denominated Eurobond to be issued in November or December. Interest payments and redemption will also be in dollars, it said.
Russian officials are now conducting a road-show around the world's financial centres.
